channel.title: Alberta.ca Newsroom
channel.description: News and information about the government of Alberta. Includes news releases, news stories, and sign-up for an e-mail index of news releases.

item.title: Data Privacy Day: Minister Glubish
item.description: Minister of Technology and Innovation Nate Glubish issued the following statement on Data Privacy Day:
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Supporting pre-treatment housing in Calgary
item.description: Pre-treatment programs can be a bridge between detox and treatment for people who are pursuing recovery from addiction.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Holocaust Remembrance Day: Premier Smith
item.description: Premier Danielle Smith issued this statement remembering the Holocaust:
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Reimagining downtown Edmonton
item.description: Alberta’s government is investing in Edmonton’s downtown to support projects that create an exciting place to live and work.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: An alternative to Just Transition: Premier Smith
item.description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith invites Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to work with her to develop “Sustainable Jobs” legislation as an alternative to the proposed “Just Transition” legislation.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Natural gas rates declining in February
item.description: The natural gas rebate and other supports remain in place to help consumers as natural gas rates decline in February.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Addressing rural physician shortages
item.description: To help bring more physicians to rural Alberta, Alberta’s government is working to offer physician training in Lethbridge and Grande Prairie.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Taking action on insurance | Intervenir en matière d’assurance
item.description: Alberta’s government is pausing private passenger vehicle insurance rate increases through to the end of 2023.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Defamatory CBC article: Statement from Premier Smith
item.description: Premier Danielle Smith issued the following statement on a defamatory article published by CBC:
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Advancing hydrogen use in transportation
item.description: Alberta’s government is seeking input on developing hydrogen fuelling stations to help support future low-emission transportation needs.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Airdrie set to spur downtown development
item.description: Alberta’s government has approved a useful tool to help the City of Airdrie further develop its downtown core.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Safer highways for Sylvan Lake drivers
item.description: Alberta’s government has built two roundabouts and completed the twinning of Highway 11 south of Sylvan Lake.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Bell Let’s Talk Day: Minister Milliken
item.description: Minister of Mental Health and Addiction Nicholas Milliken issued the following statement:
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Helping Calgary roll out the welcome mat
item.description: Alberta’s government is investing in Calgary’s downtown to support a vibrant and safe community and grow economic momentum.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Helping more students with disabilities
item.description: An additional 5,200 students will receive disability funding with new changes to the Grant for Students with Disabilities.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: HCAP: Lowering surgical wait times in Calgary | PASS : réduire les temps d’attente en chirurgie à Calgary
item.description: Albertans will have access to thousands more publicly funded orthopedic surgeries at Calgary chartered surgical facilities as part of the Health Care Action Plan (HCAP).
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Review of emails: Statement from Premier Smith
item.description: Premier Danielle Smith issued the following statement following the comprehensive review of emails between the Alberta Crown Prosecution Services and Premier’s Office staff:
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: No evidence of email contact
item.description: A comprehensive review of emails has not generated any records of contact between the Alberta Crown Prosecution Service (ACPS) and the Premier’s Office staff.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Celebrating the Lunar New Year: Premier Smith
item.description: Premier Danielle Smith issued the following statement on the start of the Lunar New Year:
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Protect yourself from scammers | Protégez-vous des escrocs
item.description: Albertans should use caution if they receive a text message claiming to be from government about affordability payments.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Nominate outstanding efforts in community justice | Récompenser des efforts exceptionnels en matière de justice communautaire
item.description: Albertans are invited to nominate individuals and organizations that have made Alberta’s communities safer.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Improving Alberta’s response to public health emergencies
item.description: Premier Danielle Smith is establishing an expert panel to review the legislation and governance practices used by the Government of Alberta during the management of the COVID-19 public health emergency and to recommend changes necessary to improve government response to future health emergencies.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Cutting red tape for food trade in Lloydminster
item.description: The Alberta and Saskatchewan governments and the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) are partnering to remove barriers to interprovincial food trade in Lloydminster.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: First shipment of children’s medication arrives | Arrivée de la première cargaison de médicaments pour enfants
item.description: Alberta’s first shipment of children’s liquid acetaminophen has arrived and will be distributed to hospitals across the province immediately.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Attracting global talent to solve job market gaps | Attraction de talents étrangers pour combler les lacunes du marché du travail
item.description: Alberta’s government is working to attract more newcomers to help grow the economy and address labour shortages in key sectors.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Alberta ends agreement to hold immigration detainees
item.description: Alberta is ending the practice of holding federal immigration detainees in provincial jails and is calling on the federal government to find better alternatives.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Affordability payment portal opens January 18 | Lancement du portail des versements visant à rendre la vie plus abordable le 18 janvier
item.description: Beginning January 18 at 9 a.m., eligible Alberta parents and seniors can apply to receive $600 in affordability payments over six months.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: HCAP: Direct action to lower EMS response times | PASS : Action directe pour réduire les délais d’intervention des SMU
item.description: Alberta’s government is committed to ensuring an ambulance is available to everyone where and when they need it.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: ASIRT investigations concluded on three files
item.description: The Alberta Serious Incident Response Team (ASIRT) has completed its investigations into three separate incidents and released the full reports on each of them.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Growing post-secondary partnerships with India
item.description: Alberta has signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) with the Shastri Indo-Canadian Institute to strengthen ties between post-secondary institutions in Alberta and India.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Alberta intervenes in firearms lawsuits
item.description: The Federal Court has granted Alberta’s application to intervene in six lawsuits against federal legislation that bans more than 1,500 models of firearms.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Redesigning Alberta’s Legislature Grounds
item.description: Albertans have a chance to help choose the design of a new water feature for the historic Legislature grounds.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Supplying energy to Japan: Letter from Premier Smith
item.description: On Wednesday, Alberta Premier Danielle Smith sent the following letter to Prime Minister Justin Trudeau about supplying affordable, sustainable and reliable energy to Japan.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Orders in Council
item.description: Order Approved – January 10, 2023
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Federal confiscation program: Minister Shandro
item.description: Minister of Justice Tyler Shandro issued the following statement on the federal firearms confiscation program:
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Sheriffs make Alberta’s highways safer
item.description: The Alberta Sheriffs removed nearly 1,500 impaired drivers from Alberta’s highways in 2022, the first full year since being given expanded authorities.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)

item.title: Inflation relief portal and payments coming soon | Portail de lutte contre l’inflation et paiement à venir bientôt
item.description: Monthly $100 affordability payments for families, seniors, and vulnerable Albertans will be released soon, and Albertans can act now to get ready.
item.author: newsroom@gov.ab.ca (Alberta Newsroom)
